text: The 2009–10 season was AS Monaco FC's 33rd season in Ligue 1. Guy Lacombe was the club's coach, guiding them to 8th in the league, the Third Round of the Coupe de la Ligue and the Final of the Coupe de France were they lost to Paris Saint-Germain. ==Squad== Mongongu was born in Kinshasa, Zaire, now Democratic Republic of the Congo. Sagbo was born in Marseille, France. ===Out on loan=== ==Transfers== ===Summer=== In: Out: ===Winter=== In: Out: ==Competitions== ===Ligue 1=== ====Results summary==== ====Results==== ====League table==== ===Coupe de la Ligue=== ===Coupe de France=== ==Squad statistics== ===Appearances and goals=== |- |colspan="14"|Players away from the club on loan: |- |colspan="14"|Players who left Monaco during the season: |} ===Goal Scorers=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 95%;
